general.serviceName: Sign in to or create your GOV.UK One Login
general.noWelshNoticeInline: This service is not available in Welsh.
general.noWelshNoticeGlobal: If a service you’ve accessed is not available in Welsh it will appear here in English.

content.paragraph1: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.
content.paragraph2: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.
content.signInUserButtonText: Go to your GOV.UK One Login
content.signOutUserButtonText: Sign in to GOV.UK One Login

error500.title: Sorry, there is a problem with the service
error500.header: Sorry, there is a problem with the service

content.listItem1: have not used your GOV.UK One Login for more than 2 hours
content.listItem2: signed out of your GOV.UK One Login while using another service
content.paragraph2: We signed you out to keep your GOV.UK One Login and your information secure.
content.signInButtonText: Sign in to GOV.UK One Login

errors.invalidCode: The code you entered is not correct, check your authenticator app and try again
errors.required: Enter the code shown in your authenticator app
errors.maxLength: Enter the code using only 6 digits
errors.invalidFormat: Enter the code using only numbers

globalLogout.title: Sign out of all devices
globalLogout.paragraph1: Sign out of GOV.UK One Login on all devices.
globalLogout.paragraph2: You might want to do this if:
globalLogout.listItem2: you think someone else might have access to your information
globalLogout.paragraph3: Signing out will help keep your information safe.
globalLogout.cancelButton: Cancel and go back to Security

searchServices.title: Services you can use with GOV.UK One Login
searchServices.metaDescription: Search for government services you can use with GOV.UK One Login.
searchServices.heading: Services you can use with GOV.UK One Login
paragraphs: At the moment, you can only use GOV.UK One Login to access some government services.
In the future, you’ll be able to use it to access all services on GOV.UK.
searchServices.searchButton: Search for services using GOV.UK One Login

noResultsBlock.heading: There are no matching results
noResultsBlock.paragraph2: If there are still no matching results, the service you’re looking for might not be using GOV.UK One Login yet.
noResultsBlock.paragraph3: You can go to the GOV.UK homepage to find the service you need.
noResultsBlock.welshDisclaimer: If there are still no matching results, the service might not be available in Welsh. Go to the English page to find a service in English.

searchServices.welshDisclaimer: Only services that are available in Welsh will appear in the results. Go to the English page to find a service in English.

mfaSection.heading: How you get security codes to sign in

phoneNumber.title: Text message to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber]

backup.heading: Your back-up method
backup.paragraph: We recommend you add a back-up method for getting security codes.
backup.paragraph2: This will make sure you can always sign in, even if you cannot get security codes using your default method.

manageEmailSubscriptions.heading: GOV.UK email subscriptions
manageEmailSubscriptions.info: See and manage the emails you get about updates to pages on GOV.UK.

deleteAccount.heading: Delete your GOV.UK One Login
deleteAccount.info: This will permanently delete your GOV.UK One Login. You’ll no longer be able to access the services you’ve used with it.

activityHistory.heading: Activity history
activityHistory.info: See what you’ve accessed with your GOV.UK One Login and when.

globalLogout.heading: Sign out of all devices
globalLogout.info: You can sign out of all devices to help keep your GOV.UK One Login safe.

confirmaddBackup.title: You’ve added a back-up method for getting security codes
confirmaddBackup.heading: You’ve added a back-up method for getting security codes
confirmaddBackup.message: If your default method for getting security codes is not available, you can get a code from this authenticator app instead.

addBackup.title: Choose a back-up method

sms.title: Back-up phone number
sms.hint: Get a text message to a different mobile phone

app.title: Authenticator app for smartphone, tablet or computer

help.title: What is an authenticator app?
help.text1: An authenticator app creates a security code that helps confirm it’s you when you sign in.
help.text2: You can use an authenticator app on your smartphone, tablet or desktop computer. Download an authenticator app for your smartphone or tablet from your app store or search online for an authenticator app for your computer.

addBackup.backLink: Cancel and go back to Security

sms.message: You can get security codes by text message as your back-up method.

errors.required: Select a way to get security codes

addBackupApp.title: Set up an authenticator app

step1.text: 1. Open your authenticator app on your smartphone, tablet, or computer.
step1.hintTitle: I do not have an authenticator app
hintText: You can download an authenticator app for your smartphone or tablet from your app store.
If you do not have a smartphone or tablet, search online for an authenticator app for your computer
You can use any authenticator app.

step2.text: 2. Use your authenticator app to scan the QR code.
step2.hintTitle: I cannot scan the QR code
step2.hintText:
You can enter the secret key into your authenticator app instead.

Secret key:
[secretKey]

Some authenticator apps call the secret key a 'code'.
step2.altText: QR code to set up authenticator app

step3.text: 3. The authenticator app will show a security code.

step4.hint: This is the 6-digit number shown in your authenticator app

addBackupApp.cancel: Cancel and go back to Security

confirm.title: You’ve added a back-up method for getting security codes
confirm.heading: You’ve added a back-up method for getting security codes
confirm.message: If your default method for getting security codes is not available, you can get a code to your phone number ending with [mobile] instead.

removeBackupMethod.title: Remove your back-up method for getting security codes
removeBackupMethod.paragraph: This will delete your back-up method for getting security codes.
removeBackupMethod.sms: We’ll no longer send security codes by text message to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].
removeBackupMethod.app: We’ll no longer send security codes to your authenticator app.
removeBackupMethod.cancelBackLink: Cancel and go back to Security

confirm.title: You’ve removed your back-up method for getting security codes
confirm.heading: You’ve removed your back-up method for getting security codes.
confirm.message_app: You’ll no longer get security codes to your authenticator app.
confirm.message_sms: You’ll no longer get security codes to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].

activityHistory.title: Activity history
activityHistory.explanation: See what you’ve accessed with your GOV.UK One Login and when.
activityHistory.empty: There is a problem showing your activity history at the moment. You can try again later or contact the GOV.UK One Login team.
activityHistory.notice: If you see something you do not recognise, report it and change your password.
activityHistory.featureIntro: GOV.UK One Login started recording activity history on 12 March 2024.
activityHistory.securityNoticeTitle: If there’s activity you do not recognise
activityHistory.securityNoticeContent1: You should change your password. This is the best way to keep your GOV.UK One Login safe.
activityHistory.securityNoticeContent2: You can also report it to the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab). The team reviews and acts on these reports but you will not get a personalised reply.
activityHistory.noWelshNotice: If a service you’ve visited is not available in Welsh it will appear here in English.

reportSuspiciousActivity.title: Report activity you do not recognise
reportSuspiciousActivity.header: Report activity you do not recognise
reportSuspiciousActivity.paragraph1: If you do not recognise this activity, report it to the GOV.UK One Login team.
reportSuspiciousActivity.paragraph2: A confirmation email with your report number will be sent to [email].

success.title: You’ve reported activity you do not recognise
success.header: You’ve reported activity you do not recognise
success.paragraph: Thanks for reporting this activity. A confirmation email with your report number has been sent to [email].

section1.heading: Change your password
section1.paragraph1: Change your password if you have not done this already.
section1.paragraph2: Changing your password is the best way to keep your GOV.UK One Login secure.
section1.listItem1: create a secure and memorable password, for example by using 3 random words
section1.listItem2: use a different password to the one you use to sign in to your email

section2.heading: What happens next
section2.paragraph1: The GOV.UK One Login team will investigate your report.
section2.paragraph2: We’ll only email you again if you need to do something to help protect your GOV.UK One Login.
section2.paragraph3: We’ll always include your report number when we email you.

section3.heading: If you need to contact us
section3.paragraph1: You can contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in a new tab).
section3.paragraph2: You’ll need to quote your report number when you contact us. You can find it in the confirmation email we’ve just sent you.

alreadyReported.title: You’ve already reported this activity
alreadyReported.noReportNo: You’ll get a confirmation email with your report number.

contact.heading: If you need to contact us
contact.paragraph1: You can contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in a new tab).
contact.paragraph2: You’ll need to quote your report number when you contact us.

yourServices.title: Your services
yourServices.intro: When you access a service with your GOV.UK One Login, it will appear here. You can go directly to a service to use it again.
yourServices.empty: You’re not using any services with your GOV.UK One Login yet.

informationBox.heading: Services you can use with GOV.UK One Login
informationBox.paragraph1: GOV.UK One Login is new. At the moment you can only use it to access some government services.
informationBox.paragraph2: In the future, you’ll be able to use GOV.UK One Login to access all services on GOV.UK.
informationBox.paragraph3: See the services you can use with GOV.UK One Login.

changeEmail.paragraph: We need to make sure it’s you before you can change your email address.

changePassword.title: Enter your current password
changePassword.paragraph: We need to make sure it’s you before you can change your password.

removeBackup.paragraph: We need to make sure it’s you before you can manage how you get security codes.

changeDefaultMethod.paragraph: We need to make sure it’s you before you can manage how you get security codes.

enterPassword.cancelText: Cancel and go back to Security

validationError.length: Email address must be 256 characters or fewer
validationError.email: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com
validationError.alreadyInUse: There’s already a GOV.UK One Login using that email address. Enter a different email address.
validationError.sameEmail: You are already using that email address. Enter a different email address.
validationError.emailCantBeUsed: You are unable to use that email address. Enter a different email address.

dontWantTo.changeEmailLinkText: Cancel and go back to Security

updateEmailConfirmation.title: You’ve changed your email address
updateEmailConfirmation.summaryText: Your email address has been changed to [email]

updatePhoneNumberConfirmation.title: You’ve changed your phone number
updatePhoneNumberConfirmation.summaryText: We’ll send security codes to your phone number ending with [mobile].

updateAuthenticatorAppConfirmation.title: You’ve changed your authenticator app
updateAuthenticatorAppConfirmation.summaryText: We’ll send security codes to your new authenticator app.

deleteAccountConfirmation.title: You’ve deleted your GOV.UK One Login
deleteAccountConfirmation.panelText: You’ve deleted your GOV.UK One Login
deleteAccountConfirmation.summaryText: If you need to use a GOV.UK One Login in the future, you’ll have to create a new one.

changePassword.title: Enter your new password

password.hint: Your password must be at least 8 characters and must include letters and numbers. Do not use a very common password, such as ‘password’ or a sequence of numbers.
password.label: Enter a new password

validationError.maxLength: Your password must be less than 256 characters
validationError.commonPassword: Enter a stronger password. Do not use very common passwords, such as ‘password’ or a sequence of numbers.
validationError.samePassword: You are already using that password. Enter a different password.
validationError.alphaNumeric: Your password must be at least 8 characters long and must include letters and numbers

validationError.matches: Enter the same password in both fields

securePasswordDetails.summary: How to create a secure password
securePasswordDetails.text: A good way to create a secure and memorable password is to use 3 random words. You can use numbers, symbols and spaces.

changePassword.backLink: Cancel and go back to Security

checkYourEmail.title: Check your email
checkYourEmail.text: We have sent an email to:

info.paragraph1: The email contains a 6 digit security code.
info.paragraph2: Your email might take a few minutes to arrive. If you do not get an email, check your spam folder.
info.paragraph3: The code will expire after 15 minutes.

validationError.maxLength: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.minLength: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.invalidFormat: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.invalidCode: The code you entered is not correct, or may have expired, try entering it again or request a new code.

checkYourPhone.title: Check your phone
checkYourPhone.text: We have sent a code to your phone number ending with [mobile].

info.paragraph: It might take a few minutes to arrive. The code will expire after 15 minutes.

details.text: We can send the code again or you can use a different phone number.

validationError.maxLength: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.minLength: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.invalidFormat: Enter the code using only 6 digits
validationError.invalidCode: The code you entered is not correct, or may have expired, try entering it again or request a new code.

changeDefaultMethod.title: Use a different default method
changeDefaultMethod.currentIsPhone: Your default method for getting security codes is currently by text message to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].
changeDefaultMethod.switchToApp: You can use an authenticator app instead.
changeDefaultMethod.currentIsApp: Your default method for getting security codes is currently using your authenticator app.
changeDefaultMethod.switchToPhone: You can get codes by text message instead.
changeDefaultMethod.setUpPhoneButton: Add a UK mobile phone number
changeDefaultMethod.cancelButton: Cancel and go back to Security

confirmation.title: You’ve changed your default method for getting security codes
confirmation.heading: You’ve changed your default method for getting security codes
confirmation.app: Your default method for getting security codes is now your authenticator app.
confirmation.sms: Your default method for getting security codes will be a text message to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].

deleteAccount.title: Are you sure you want to delete your GOV.UK One Login?
deleteAccount.header: Are you sure you want to delete your GOV.UK One Login?
deleteAccount.paragraph1: This will permanently delete the sign in details for your GOV.UK One Login.
deleteAccount.paragraph2Many: You will no longer be able to use your GOV.UK One Login to access:
deleteAccount.paragraph2One: You will no longer be able to use your GOV.UK One Login to access: [serviceName].
deleteAccount.paragraph3: This will not affect government accounts that you do not access with GOV.UK One Login, such as Government Gateway or Universal Credit.
deleteAccount.paragraph4: It will not delete the personal information held by services you’ve used.
deleteAccount.paragraph5: If you need a GOV.UK One Login in the future, you’ll have to create a new one.
deleteAccount.explanationListItem2: the record of which services you’ve accessed with GOV.UK One Login and when
deleteAccount.details: If you use the GOV.UK One Login app, any digital documents in it will be removed. For example, a digital Veteran Card.
deleteAccount.doNotDeleteAccount: Cancel and go back to Security

englishServicesInWelshExplanation.title: Why are some services listed in English?
englishServicesInWelshExplanation.body: If a service you’ve accessed is not available in Welsh it will appear here in English.

changePhoneNumber.header: Enter your new UK mobile phone number

info.paragraph1: We will send a 6 digit security code to the number you give us.

info.noUkPhone: I do not have a UK mobile phone number

validationError.samePhoneNumber: You’re already using that phone number. Enter a different phone number

validationError.required: Enter a UK mobile phone number
validationError.international: Enter a UK mobile phone number
validationError.length: Enter a UK mobile phone number, like 07700 900000
validationError.plusNumericOnly: Enter a UK mobile phone number using only numbers or the + symbol

noUkPhoneNumber.title: If you do not have a UK mobile phone number
noUkPhoneNumber.header: If you do not have a UK mobile phone number
noUkPhoneNumber.paragraph1: To get security codes by text message, you need to use a UK mobile phone number.
noUkPhoneNumber.paragraph2: If you do not have a UK mobile phone number, you can get security codes using an authenticator app instead.
noUkPhoneNumber.detailTextLine2: An authenticator app creates a security code that helps confirm it's you when you sign in.
noUkPhoneNumber.detailTextLine3: You can use an authenticator app on your smartphone, tablet or desktop computer. Download an authenticator app for your smartphone or tablet from your app store or search online for an authenticator app for your computer.
noUkPhoneNumber.paragraph3: To set up an authenticator app to get security codes:
noUkPhoneNumber.backLinkButton: Cancel and go back to Security

signedOut.title: You have signed out
signedOut.signInLinkText: sign in to your GOV.UK One Login

resendMfaCode.title: Get security code
resendMfaCode.message: Text messages can sometimes take a few minutes to arrive.
resendMfaCode.cancel: Cancel and go back to Security

phoneNumber.insetText: We will send a code to your phone number ending with [mobile].
phoneNumber.paragraph: Text messages can sometimes take a few minutes to arrive.

email.recipientMessage: We will send a code to:
email.paragraph: Your email might take a few minutes to arrive. If you do not get an email, check your spam folder.

switchBackupMethod.newDefaultApp: Your default method for getting security codes will be using your authenticator app.
switchBackupMethod.newDefaultSms: Your default method for getting security codes will be a text message to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].
switchBackupMethod.newBackupApp: Your authenticator app will become your back-up method.

switchBackupMethod.cancelLinkText: Cancel and go back to Security

confirm.title: You’ve switched your back-up and default methods for getting security codes
confirm.heading: You’ve switched your back-up and default methods for getting security codes
confirm.messageSms: We’ll send security codes to your phone number ending with [phoneNumber].
confirm.messageApp: You’ll use your authenticator app to get security codes to sign in.

contact.title: Contact GOV.UK One Login
contact.metaDescription: Contact us for help using your GOV.UK One Login including problems signing in, proving your identity or managing your details. Call or talk to us online.

section1.heading: Before you contact us
paragraphs: Read our guidance if you’re having a problem with:

links.text: Proving your identity with the GOV.UK One Login app
Proving your identity with GOV.UK One Login by answering security questions
Help adding your Veteran Card to the GOV.UK One Login app
Changing the sign in details for your GOV.UK One Login
Getting a security code for GOV.UK One Login
An unexpected email, text message or phone call about your GOV.UK One Login
Using the GOV.UK ID Check app
Linking the GOV.UK ID Check app to GOV.UK

section1.guidanceForHelpers: If you’re having trouble using GOV.UK One Login by yourself, you can get help from someone you know and trust. Find out what the person who helps you can and cannot do.

paragraphsWebchat: If you call or use webchat to contact the GOV.UK One Login team, you will be asked for a reference code.
This code helps us to see where you may be having a problem.
paragraphsNoWebchat: When you contact us by phone, you’ll be asked for a reference code.
This code helps us to see where you may be having a problem.

webchat.heading: Webchat
paragraphs1: Get help from GOV.UK One Login’s digital assistant or chat with a member of the support team.
You might be asked for your reference code when you chat to us.
You can chat live with our support team Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm UK time.
The digital assistant is always available.
Use webchat to get help from GOV.UK One Login’s digital assistant or chat with a member of the support team.
You need JavaScript to use webchat.
The browser you’re using does not support JavaScript or it’s turned off. You can either:
listItems: contact us by phone or email instead
turn on JavaScript in your browser
paragraphs2: You can follow the instructions to turn on JavaScript in your browser (these links open in a new tab):

phone.heading: Phone
paragraphs: You’ll need your reference code when you call.
phone.paragraph2: You can call us Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm UK time.
phone.waitingTimeWarning: There are currently long waiting times on the phone. If your call is not urgent, try again later or fill in the contact form.

email.heading: Email
paragraphs: Fill in the contact form to ask for help.
We’ll reply by email within 2 days.

We’ll respond during office hours:
Monday to Friday, 9:30am to 5:30pm UK time

section4.heading: How we use your information
section4.paragraph: To find out what information we store when you contact us and how we use it, see the GOV.UK One Login privacy notice.

permanentlySuspendedScreen.title: Your GOV.UK One Login has been permanently locked
permanentlySuspendedScreen.header: Your GOV.UK One Login has been permanently locked

section1.paragraph1: You’ve been signed out and you can no longer use your GOV.UK One Login.

section2.heading: What you can do
section2.paragraph1: If you need a GOV.UK One Login to access a government service you can create a new one using a different email address.

link.text: Go to the service you need to use to continue

section2.paragraph1: You cannot use your GOV.UK One Login at the moment.
